column5: I have relatives that have property by Bon Echo. We used to use it for Wally opening . .  I found a shed on a walk and took it home. After a while I figure this belonged back where I found it. I designed a wooden sign, (something you see ona golf course) with the family's last name, had it carved out  and mounted the shed. They now use it has a hat rack as you walk in the door. Everyone is happy.  me for the creative and they for the thought and use!  Something rustic is always welcome.  Cliff, no French for you lol

personalized guest register book is cool.  lots of pages and lots of memories of those you shared memorable times with at your place.  I'll 2nd this idea,  we have one, the guests and my wife like writing in it, each page has a date, the weather, who was there, what we did, what we saw, favorite moments  when I skim though it, it helps keep track of the smaller details  when we got it, I thought it was cheesy, now I think it's great
What great idea,  it will keep the family's cottage history alive. keep it safe.  I had important note on my iPad and thought they were safe, wrong, changed Internet supplier and they were gone
Im stumped here! im looking for some little nick nack that every cottager doesnt know they need until they need it!!! haha  help!
a quality bird/hummingbird feeder
Live-in French Maid???????????
A wooden carving of their last name.  Doesn't every cottage have one of those!
cough ,cough....Ced-Art---Hack.....wheeze,....... cough  ok shameless plug
LCBO gift card
a framed quality map of the area/lake.  bonus points if it is an old one.
http://highlands1344.wix.com/cedart
Steve's got it... although I love DanD's idea as well !
Thanks Mike---for some reason I'm unable to cut and paste here--L'il glitch I guess
I'd love one of these:  http://www.lakefxstore.com/wood_lake_art/  Might break the budget though.
Hammock
personalized guest register book is cool.  lots of pages and lots of memories of those you shared memorable times with at your place.
binoculars / telescope
Love the map idea, also those metal  powerless fans for the fireplace or wood stove are awesome and last for generations
Those giant rapalas look neat hanging in the cottage.  http://www.rapala.com/rapala/lures/rapalaandreg-giant-lure/Rapala+Giant+Lure.html
Set of horseshoes.
a muskoka chair to sit on the end of the dock !!!! seagulls like them.....
I'll take the french maid too, but I don't have a cottage. I'd like to have one. Does that count ?
A dock

They all sound great. This is the place to ask when you need some answers. Something historical for the area is always cool. A good map of the area/lake on the wall is always nice for visitors. Hard to pass up on the French maid though.

This is what I did for my buddy and his wife for their cottage. Step 1-,got a large old circular saw blade(30in),Step 2- got a buddy to clean it up,Step 3- I took lots of pics of the cottage from the water,step 4 - had an artist friend paint on the saw blade  a picture of the cottage.Everybody LOVED  it...Ok it did take about a year to put this all together but it worked out great.  vance
You can build them a Hillbilly Horseshoe game(washers)

Tried the French maid idea once, wife told me that by the time the divorce was over I wouldn't even have the cottage never mind the French maid. I think I'd scrap that idea if I were you.  The map is a really good idea, I have seen many of them in friends cottages, you never get tired of looking at them!  I nice sign would also work, many others have nice signs but their's would be unique!  Good on you for taking the time to try to find the "perfect" gift, says a lot about your character!
A thermometer, inside or out. A dinner bell. Marshmellow roasting forks. An old coal oil lantern. A door knocker
